review_blob: Very nice beer.  Yellowy-gold in color...soft palate and honeyish start, with a typical tripel finish.  Great effort by the brewer, and would recommend this beer to try if you get the chance.
Very different for a saison.  Seem to have a strong honey taste up front, which to me was quite pleasant.  Not too sweet, with a dry finish.
The juniper flavor is so overpowering.  There is no balance with that favor and the hops and malt.
Very interesting beer.  Has strong notes of orange in the flavor, which really makes this a wonderfully refreshing beer for the summer.
Nice sour ale.  Not as sour as the standard Rodenbach, and has hints of caramel in the background, but only slight, as most of the taste is sourish.  Very refreshing sour

This is very different from most triples.  Much more of an amber color than the typical golden color.  Also much more caramel sweet notes with this beer, and less citrusy than normal.  I think it is wonderfully clean and refreshing, yet has some characteristics of their dubbel.  If youre a true triple lover, this may not be your favorite though.  However, if you love dubbels, give this a try...youll love it.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Great beer.  The aroma of hops is strong, but the taste is beautifully balanced, with not as much hop taste as you would expect.  Some nice sweet notes with this beer

This ale is reminesent of a cross between and strong english ale and and a belgian dubbel.  It has the roasted maltiness of the english ale, with the sweetness of the begian dubbel (rainins, plums, candi-sugar).  Really quite an interesting and delicious beer.  The best christmas ale from England that I have tasted

Very nice beer.  Pours a dark brown with a typically big wheat beer head.  The usually fruity wheat beer flavors (apple, banana, etc) are not really present, and this beer tastes more like a Doppelbock then a Weizenbock.  Very malty, with a smooth finish, and a bit of a thick feel on the tongue.  A very good beer

If youre a true stout lover, then this probably isnt for you.  Much more like a belgian dubbel than a stout.  However, based on taste alone, it is a good beer.  Deep brown in color, with a head that disapates quickly.  Smooth caramel type flavors, and fairly sweet.

This is a nice beer, and would be great with a desert of dark chocolate cake.  Aromas of roasted malts, raspberry, and chocolate.  Pours a dark brown/black color.  The raspberry taste is quite strong in my opinion, which I like, but I dont agree with the brewers deScription that the stout is "kissed" with raspberry....it has a much stronger presense than that states
Although I did not detect a typical "Christmas" flare, this was a nice Bock.  Paler in color than typical Bock, it was a deep honey color, nice malt sweetness, and very easy to drink.
A pale hazy golden color, with a strong aroma of bourbon, and a taste of bourbon that is extremely strong, yet sweeten by the ale.  Interesting beer, and definitely for those who love bourbon

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: This is a very nice and unique beer.  Very refreshing in my opinion, and a great summer beer.  Okay, heres the weird thing....drink it with dry Cheerios (not combined).  Im not one for pairing beer with food, and this is off-the-charts odd, but they really work well together.  If you dont like it, dont sue me, lol.

Very average beer.  Very thin with little malty taste.  Aroma had a malty hint, but still quite plain.  One time the Belgians should stick to their own style, and leave the Scotch Ales to the Scottish, lol.  Not aweful, but too many other good Scoth Ales to waste time with this one.
This is a very enjoyable beer.  It has a pleasant maltiness, and very smooth finish.  Very enjoyable relaxing beer, that still tastes great as it warms

This is by-far the best tasting Strong Belgian-Style Ale by an American brewery Ive had.  It has a sweet fruity aroma, with a hint of alcohol.  The head leaves quickly, but the smooth texture of the beer is very enjoyable.  As close to a copy of Rochefort 8 or Westmalle Dubbel as you can get from an American brewery.

Ok...they really shouldnt call this a stout if based on taste.  It should have a disclaimer saying...if you love stouts and looking for that flavor, youll hate this beer.  HOWEVER, if you go into the tasting knowing that this will not taste like a traditional stout, you may like it.  It was watery and very very sweet, with hints of fruit, and malt, which was quite enjoyable.  Somewhat more like a thin barley wine or scothish ale.  Anyway, go in with an open mind, and you may like it.
Reminded me of Heiniken, but a much better substitute.  Still was a bit bitter, but did have a smoother finish, which I found more enjoyable.  If you like Heiniken, Id recommend trying this beer

Honetly, there are very few beers I think are terrible, but this is one.  Forget discribing the malt or hoppiness.  After tasting it on two separate occasions, I finally realized what the taste reminded me of....a dirty ashtray.  I am not kidding.  It tasted like someone was blowing their old cigarette smoke into the botte.  I love Scottish Ales, but avoid this one.
This is one of the best bitter Ive found.  Good flavor, but still very smooth for a bitter.
